concept.title: Example: Link modification or removal
concept.shortdesc: This scenario outlines how different authors can effectively remove or modify a link element in a shared topic.

conbody.p: A company wants to use a shared topic for information about customer support. For most products, the shared topic should include a link to a topic about extended warranties. But a small number of products do not offer extended warranties.

li.p: Team one creates the shared topic: customer-support.dita. The topic contains the following mark-up:

The teams that need the link to the topic about extended warranties can reference the customer-support.dita topic in their DITA maps. When processed, the related link in the topic resolves to the common/extended-warranties.dita topic.
The teams that do not want the related link to the topic about extended warranties can include a key definition that in their DITA map that does not include an href attribute, for example:
When processed, the related link in the topic is not rendered.
Yet another team wants to simply have a paragraph about extended warranties printed. They define the key definition for "extended-warranties" as follows:
li.codeblock: <map> <!-- ... --> <keydef keys="extended-warranties"/> <topicmeta> <linktext>This product does not offer extended warranties.</linktext> </topicmeta> <!-- ... --> </map>
li.p: When this team renders their content, there is no hyperlink in the output, just the "The product does not offer extended warranties" statement.
